thread.title: ‘A Sporting Vision: The Paul Mellon Collection of British Sporting Art From the Virginia Museum of Fine Arts’ Review

author: E.A. Carmean Jr.
title: ‘A Sporting Vision: The Paul Mellon Collection of British Sporting Art From the Virginia Museum of Fine Arts’ Review
text:
Middleburg, Va.
‘I discovered many a man who would pay me fifty guineas for a painting of a horse, who thinks ten guineas too much for a painting of his wife,” recounted Georgian-era artist Benjamin Marshall. Decades later, one man would pay considerably more for many of Marshall’s horse or shooting pictures: Paul Mellon, the renowned collector of French Impressionist and early Modern works as well as British sporting art.
Mellon,...
